artist: Kitagawa Utamaro; Published by Murataya Jirōbei
creditline: Gift of Ruth Lathrop Sikes in memory of her brother Bruce Sikes, 1967
marks:
[おもふその　人にハきせし　月草の　花すり衣　うつろふがうき]
{Omou sono / Hito [歌麿筆] {Utamaro hitsu}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text:
Executed in the rare, long paper format (nagaban), this print depicts a courtesan and her attendant playing with a child that could be hers from a previous love affair. The waka poem reads: 

I rub the flower of evening primerose
In the cloth of the man I love
Wishing the scent of the flower
Reminds him of me
title: (Courtesan with a Child Playing Piggyback)
